meanings.sent1: The blare of the fire alarm startled everyone in the building.
meanings.sent2: The blare of the trumpet filled the room with music.
meanings.sent3: The blare of the car horn made the toddler giggle.
meanings.sent4: The blare of the sirens echoed through the empty streets.
meanings.sent5: The blare of the thunder shook the windows.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh sound
meanings.sent1: The car engines blare as they race down the track.
meanings.sent2: The speakers blare music at the outdoor concert.
meanings.sent3: The alarm clock blares, waking up the sleepy student.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks blare in the night sky, lighting up the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The megaphone blares instructions to the crowd.

meanings.sent1: The sirens blare as the emergency vehicles rush to the scene.
meanings.sent2: The horns blare in the busy city traffic.
meanings.sent3: The radio blares out the latest news updates.
meanings.sent4: The wind blares through the trees on a stormy night.
meanings.sent5: The alarm system blares to alert of any intruders.
